allow:
Bash(gh issue create --title "Add clickable step navigation to onboarding wizard" --body "$(cat <<''EOF''
Users cannot go back to previous onboarding steps without using browser back button. This causes issues when they need to correct information entered earlier. Add a visual step indicator that allows clicking on completed steps.

## Current Behavior
- Progress bar shows percentage but steps aren''t clickable
- Only "Back" button available (goes to immediately previous step)
- No way to jump to Step 2 from Step 4

## Desired Behavior
- Visual step indicator: `[1✓] → [2✓] → [3●] → [4] → [5]`
- Completed steps (checkmark) are clickable
- Current step highlighted
- Future steps not clickable

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Step indicator component created showing all 5 steps
- [ ] Completed steps display checkmark and are clickable
- [ ] Current step visually distinct (highlighted)
- [ ] Clicking completed step navigates correctly
- [ ] Progress bar percentage syncs with step indicator
- [ ] Step indicator responsive on mobile (stacks or scrolls)
- [ ] State persists (can click Step 2, then Step 4, then back to Step 2)

## Files to Change
- `components/ui/StepNavigator.jsx` (NEW - create component)
- `app/page.js` (add StepNavigator, pass step/setStep props)
- `components/Step1/Step1.jsx` (add StepNavigator at top)
- `components/Step2/Step2.jsx` (add StepNavigator at top)
- `components/Step3/Step3.jsx` (add StepNavigator at top)
- `components/Step4/Step4.jsx` (add StepNavigator at top)
- `components/Step5/Step5.jsx` (add StepNavigator at top)

## Estimated Time
3-4 hours

## Dependencies
None (foundation ticket)
EOF
)" --label "priority: critical,type: navigation,epic: navigation-wayfinding")
